meanings.definition: The belief in the existence of a vital force in living organisms.
meanings.sent1: In zoism, it is thought that all living things possess a special energy.
meanings.sent2: Her zoism led her to respect all forms of life around her.
meanings.sent3: The idea of zoism made him imagine plants and animals chatting with each other.
meanings.sent4: The concept of zoism paints life as a symphony of interconnected energies.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained zoism by comparing it to the heartbeat of nature.

meanings.definition: A doctrine that life is the essential principle of the universe.
meanings.sent1: The ancient philosophy of zoism teaches that life is at the core of everything.
meanings.sent2: His belief in zoism made him appreciate the beauty of existence.
meanings.sent3: The idea of zoism being the universe's heartbeat made her smile.
meanings.sent4: Zoism is like the sun, providing warmth and light to all aspects of life.
meanings.sent5: The concept of zoism is as fundamental as the air we breathe.

meanings.definition: The attribution of animal characteristics or qualities to a god or deity.
meanings.sent1: In zoism, gods are often depicted with animal traits to show their power.
meanings.sent2: The ancient culture's zoism portrayed their deities with animal features.
meanings.sent3: The zoism of the tribe made their gods seem playful and mischievous.
meanings.sent4: Zoism can be seen in the majestic lion-headed gods of mythology.
meanings.sent5: The zoism of the religion made their gods relatable and approachable.
